test_cases.description: Tests that when main() is called with no command-line arguments (only the script name), the help menu is displayed.
test_cases.name: No arguments: Shows help menu

test_setup.given: sys.argv = ['main.py']
test_setup.then: Help menu is shown (e.g., TaskTrackerCLI.show_help() is called or help text is printed)

test_cases.description: Tests that when main() is called with one command-line argument (script name + 1 arg), the help menu is displayed.
test_cases.name: One argument: Shows help menu

test_setup.given: sys.argv = ['main.py', '']
test_setup.then: Help menu is shown

test_cases.description: Tests that when main() is called with two or more arguments, TaskTrackerCLI is initialized and run with those arguments.
test_cases.name: Multiple arguments: Initializes and runs CLI

test_setup.given: sys.argv = ['main.py', 'add', 'task1']
test_setup.then: TaskTrackerCLI is initialized and run with arguments ['add', 'task1']

test_cases.description: Tests that when main() is called with a help argument, the help menu is displayed.
test_cases.name: Help argument: Shows help menu

test_setup.given: sys.argv = ['main.py', '--help']
test_setup.then: Help menu is shown

test_cases.description: Tests that when an invalid command is given, an error is shown (handled by TaskTrackerCLI).
test_cases.name: Invalid command: Shows error

test_setup.given: sys.argv = ['main.py', 'invalidcommand']
test_setup.then: TaskTrackerCLI is initialized and shows an error message for invalid command

test_cases.description: Tests that if sys.argv is empty (rare but possible), the help menu is shown.
test_cases.name: Empty argv list: Shows help menu

test_setup.given: sys.argv = []
test_setup.then: Help menu is shown

test_cases.description: Tests that if TaskTrackerCLI or its run method raises an exception, it is handled or propagated.
test_cases.name: CLI raises exception: Handles exception

test_setup.given: sys.argv = ['main.py', 'add', 'task1']; TaskTrackerCLI.run raises Exception
test_setup.then: Exception is handled or propagated (according to implementation)

test_cases.description: Tests that arguments containing spaces are correctly passed to TaskTrackerCLI.
test_cases.name: Arguments with spaces: Passed to CLI

test_setup.given: sys.argv = ['main.py', 'add', 'my task with spaces']
test_setup.then: TaskTrackerCLI is initialized and run with ['add', 'my task with spaces']

test_cases.description: Tests that unicode arguments are correctly handled and passed to TaskTrackerCLI.
test_cases.name: Unicode arguments: Passed to CLI

test_setup.given: sys.argv = ['main.py', 'add', 'tâsk☑️']
test_setup.then: TaskTrackerCLI is initialized and run with ['add', 'tâsk☑️']

test_cases.description: Tests that a large number of arguments are all passed to TaskTrackerCLI.
test_cases.name: Too many arguments: All passed to CLI

test_setup.given: sys.argv = ['main.py', 'add'] + ['task{}'.format(i) for i in range(100)]
test_setup.then: TaskTrackerCLI is initialized and run with all arguments

test_cases.description: Successfully add a new user with all required arguments.
test_cases.name: Add User - Success

test_setup.given: Arguments: username='alice', email='alice@example.com'. No user with this username exists.
test_setup.then: User is added and success message is printed

test_cases.description: Attempt to add a user with missing required arguments.
test_cases.name: Add User - Missing Arguments

test_setup.given: Arguments: username='bob'. Email is missing.
test_setup.then: Error message about missing email argument is printed

test_cases.description: Attempt to add a user with a username that already exists.
test_cases.name: Add User - Duplicate Username

test_setup.given: Arguments: username='alice', email='alice2@example.com'. User with username 'alice' already exists.
test_setup.then: Error message indicating username already exists is printed

test_cases.description: List users when no users exist in the system.
test_cases.name: List Users - Empty List

test_setup.given: No users in the system.
test_setup.then: Message indicating no users found is printed

test_cases.description: List users when users exist in the system.
test_cases.name: List Users - Non-empty List

test_setup.given: Users: ['alice', 'bob'] exist.
test_setup.then: List of users is printed

test_cases.description: Successfully add a new task with all required arguments.
test_cases.name: Add Task - Success

test_setup.given: Arguments: title='Fix bug', description='...', assigned_to='alice', priority='high'. User 'alice' exists.
test_setup.then: Task is added and success message is printed

test_cases.description: Attempt to add a task without specifying a title.
test_cases.name: Add Task - Missing Title

test_setup.given: Arguments: description='...', assigned_to='alice', priority='high'. Title is missing.
test_setup.then: Error message about missing title argument is printed

test_cases.description: Attempt to add a task with an invalid priority value.
test_cases.name: Add Task - Invalid Priority

test_setup.given: Arguments: title='Fix bug', description='...', assigned_to='alice', priority='urgent'. 'urgent' is not a valid priority.
test_setup.then: Error message about invalid priority value is printed

test_cases.description: Successfully update an existing task's status.
test_cases.name: Update Task - Success

test_setup.given: Task with id=1 exists. Arguments: id=1, status='done'.
test_setup.then: Task is updated and success message is printed

test_cases.description: Attempt to update a task that does not exist.
test_cases.name: Update Task - Nonexistent Task

test_setup.given: No task with id=99 exists. Arguments: id=99, status='done'.
test_setup.then: Error message indicating task does not exist is printed

test_cases.description: Attempt to update a task without specifying required arguments.
test_cases.name: Update Task - Missing Arguments

test_setup.given: Arguments: id=1. Status is missing.
test_setup.then: Error message about missing status argument is printed

test_cases.description: Successfully unassign a user from a task.
test_cases.name: Unassign Task - Success

test_setup.given: Task with id=2 is assigned to user 'bob'.
test_setup.then: Task is unassigned and success message is printed

test_cases.description: Attempt to unassign a task that is not assigned to any user.
test_cases.name: Unassign Task - Not Assigned

test_setup.given: Task with id=3 is not assigned to any user.
test_setup.then: Message indicating task is already unassigned is printed

test_cases.description: Successfully reassign a task to a different user.
test_cases.name: Reassign Task - Success

test_setup.given: Task with id=4 is assigned to 'alice'. User 'charlie' exists.
test_setup.then: Task is reassigned to 'charlie' and success message is printed
test_setup.when: reassign_task is called with id=4, new_user='charlie'

test_cases.description: Attempt to reassign a task to a user that does not exist.
test_cases.name: Reassign Task - Nonexistent User

test_setup.given: Task with id=4 exists. User 'dan' does not exist.
test_setup.then: Error message indicating user does not exist is printed
test_setup.when: reassign_task is called with id=4, new_user='dan'

test_cases.description: View tasks assigned to a specific user who has tasks.
test_cases.name: View By User - With Tasks

test_setup.given: User 'alice' has 2 assigned tasks.
test_setup.then: List of tasks assigned to 'alice' is printed

test_cases.description: View tasks assigned to a specific user with no assigned tasks.
test_cases.name: View By User - No Tasks

test_setup.given: User 'bob' has no assigned tasks.
test_setup.then: Message indicating no tasks assigned to 'bob' is printed

test_cases.description: View tasks filtered by a valid status value.
test_cases.name: View By Status - Valid Status

test_setup.given: Some tasks exist with status='in-progress'.
test_setup.then: List of tasks with status 'in-progress' is printed

test_cases.description: Attempt to view tasks with an invalid status value.
test_cases.name: View By Status - Invalid Status

test_setup.given: No status 'blocked' exists in the valid status list.
test_setup.then: Error message about invalid status is printed

test_cases.description: View tasks filtered by a valid priority value.
test_cases.name: View By Priority - Valid Priority

test_setup.given: Some tasks exist with priority='high'.
test_setup.then: List of tasks with priority 'high' is printed

test_cases.description: Attempt to view tasks with an invalid priority value.
test_cases.name: View By Priority - Invalid Priority

test_setup.given: No priority 'very-low' exists in the valid priority list.
test_setup.then: Error message about invalid priority is printed

test_cases.description: View list of overdue tasks when some are present.
test_cases.name: View Overdue - Tasks Exist

test_setup.given: Some tasks exist with due dates in the past.
test_setup.then: List of overdue tasks is printed

test_cases.description: View overdue tasks when none are present.
test_cases.name: View Overdue - No Overdue Tasks

test_setup.given: No tasks with due dates in the past.
test_setup.then: Message indicating no overdue tasks is printed

test_cases.description: Search tasks with a keyword that matches some tasks.
test_cases.name: Search Tasks - Found

test_setup.given: Some tasks contain the keyword 'bug' in title or description.
test_setup.then: List of matching tasks is printed

test_cases.description: Search tasks with a keyword that matches no tasks.
test_cases.name: Search Tasks - Not Found

test_setup.given: No tasks contain the keyword 'performance'.
test_setup.then: Message indicating no tasks found is printed

test_cases.description: Display overall task statistics.
test_cases.name: Stats - Success

test_setup.given: Tasks exist in various statuses and priorities.
test_setup.then: Statistics summary is printed

test_cases.description: Add a task with a title at the maximum allowed length.
test_cases.name: Add Task - Long Title Edge Case

test_setup.given: Arguments: title length is at the system's maximum allowed (e.g., 255 characters).
test_setup.then: Task is added and success message is printed

test_cases.description: Attempt to add a task with a title exceeding the maximum allowed length.
test_cases.name: Add Task - Title Too Long

test_setup.given: Arguments: title length is 256 characters (assuming 255 is max).
test_setup.then: Error message about title length is printed

test_cases.description: Provide arguments in an invalid format to test parsing robustness.
test_cases.name: Argument Parsing - Invalid Format

test_setup.given: Arguments missing '--' prefix or use unsupported syntax.
test_setup.then: Error message about invalid argument format is printed
